description: This script, ci-start.sh, automates setting environment variables, installing dependencies via npm, copying assets, starting a React development server, and waiting for server readiness, primarily used in CI environments.

methods.name: command -v
methods.description: Checks if a command exists in the system.

methods.name: npm
methods.description: Node package manager, used here to install dependencies and check for scripts.

methods.name: npx
methods.description: Package runner for npm packages, used to start the dev server and wait for health endpoint.

methods.name: tail
methods.description: Utility to keep the script process alive by tailing /dev/null.
